title: I guess the sh*t's finally hit the fan, huh?
body:
I guess this is why people have been leaving en mass. This shouldn't come as a surprise, but, people will ALWAYS choose a game designed around sheer, consistent enjoyment. There's plenty similar games of this sort to be found nowadays.
So, someone up there should read this, get off your high horse, and start deciding how to fix this. It's make or break, and sadly your loyal fanbase's long-term investment playing this game can (read: will) too easily turn to resentment.
Let's not follow the ways of countless other hotshot companies outreach ourselves, eh?
If you follow what you preach, try reevaluating the word "humble".

replies.body: Your post lacks a lot of context tbh.  Unless I missed some huge event while I was at work.

Pretty obvious. Champion balance is in shambles, damage in general repeatedly being added to the game, lack of resists leaves you far too vulnerable now, many base damages are 3/4 of what they used to be (unless reworked) so resists are either too strong or too weak depending on if you have void/LW or not, jungle being made unbalanced every season as a tradition, new VGUs/releases are all overloaded and without trade-offs, games are being pushed to be fast-paced while the main map is a drawn-out strategic map...and even more.

There's a shit load (no pun intended) of shit the OP is referring to that's spattered all over the room that is LoL right now.

That stuff has always been on the walls.  People just change the frames...

C'mon though, the game_ would_ be boring without random stuff being tried and reworked.
That 4-week patch in December felt like an eternity.
And we haven't even reached the defensive itemization update yet since they've only reworked offensive classes so far.  Must... see...next...update...

---------
But realistically I missed nothing and such posts are business as usual on the boards.

So you're saying that if damage weren't massively inflating, the game would be boring? I'm all for changes if they're decent, just make sure they aren't ruining the game. 
___________
Next update is only going to help tanks. All the other melees that aren't overpowered at any given time are still fucked. All its going to do is make tanks look overpowered...then get them nerfed.

I'd put money on it.

Wasn't talking about damage inflation, no.
I'd like it to go down a tad too though; mastery dmg chunks especially.
I was just talking about shifts in general, but the tanks have been left completely in the dust for 2ish years.  It just feels bad.

I remember the times where the mid wouldn't basically 1-shot the tank, and when people would play Malphite and such, but then all these shield bruisers came out and the og tanks were just sad.

Next update will also indirectly help adcs too, since we'll need them to have a snowball's chance in Teemo's basement of killing them.
------------------------
Wait, which melees do you think are going to get left in the dust?
---------------------------
LOL I'm not crazy enough to bet vs that...

Yeah, I miss when it was a strategy game instead of essentially an action arena RPG too.
________
Well, either they'll address itemization, which will lead to divers resurging and tanks being left in the dust, then the itemization gets gutted...

...or we'll likely have %damage reduction for small windows on tanks (think mao/poppy/braum) that will lead to any with shields/healing to performing...just like mao and poppy, while divers that aren't overpowered get left in the dust.
__________
Overall, if the changes can't be capitalized on by pretty much all non-glass cannon melees, we'll still have issues with pretty much any non-hard-engage tanks and divers. They'll either be overpowered or very hard to make reliable use of at any given time due to the absurd damage in the game...much like many tanks atm.

I don't think they can mess up the itemization that bad. xD

Of course LoL will eventually die out, but to say Riot isn't do anything to slow down father time is dumb as fuck. The fact that this game gets two patches a month as actually proof that they are trying, but to think that League will ever truly be balanced is idiotic. 

To keep people from growing tired changes must be made, every year dam near three times a year Riot makes pretty massive changes to make the game different, so it doesn't grow stale. With those changes comes new METAs that they then need to try and balance around.

Right now people complain about the damage creep from things like masterys, or the fact that turrets lack any real defense, do you know why that is? The masses complained that games were stalling out, Ziggs would just clear waves for 30mins untill everyone was full build. So now with my damage games should end quicker? Right? Right. 

To say people are leaving if Riot doesn't do anything is ridiculous, people will leave because the game is aging and they're bored and ready to move on, or because like League they themselves are aging and life starts to kick in. Riot will keep changing the game, that is for sure, if you want to leave then see you later.
